c74object.name: nw.grainstream~
c74object.digest: Generate grains at a given frequency
c74object.description: Outputs a stream of grains at a given frequency in Hertz, and without any silence between the consecutive grain onsets. This method can produce audio output similar to wave~, but with granular-specific controls and features such as windowing. The sound source and window shape used by this object for grain production must each loaded into the buffer~ objects specified by two required arguments.

inlet.digest: Frequency in Hz. Grains are produced at this rate.
Sound offset in ms. Where to start reading the sound buffer.
Sample increment. Effects perceived pitch, 1.0 = unchanged.

outlet.digest: Audio signal: sample count since playback started. -1 = no playback.

objarg.name: sound-buffer-name
objarg.description: The first argument names the buffer~ object whose sample memory contains a source source used by this object for grain production. For more information about how this sample memory is handled, see documentation for the setSound message.

objarg.name: window-buffer-name
objarg.description: The second argument names the buffer~ object whose sample memory contains a window function used by this object for grain production. For more information about how this sample memory is handled, see documentation for the setWin message.

method.name: int
method.description: Numbers can be used instead of signal objects to control sound offset, grain duration, sample increment and gain multiplier. If a signal is also connected to the inlet, float and int messages will be ignored.

method.name: float
method.description: Numbers can be used instead of signal objects to control sound offset, grain duration, sample increment and gain multiplier. If a signal is also connected to the inlet, float and int messages will be ignored.

method.name: signal
method.description:
After a grain begins sounding, changes received by the following inlets will be deferred to the start of the next grain:
In inlet 1: Defines the frequency of grain production in Hertz. This value can be thought of as the inverse of duration, with no silence between grains. The absolute value of any negative numbers are used to prevent buffer overrun errors. If backward playback is desired, use the reverse 1 message. In addition, values less than 0.05 Hz will be ignored because of the potential for excessively long grain durations.
In inlet 2: Defines the offset in milliseconds from the beginning of the sound buffer~ where processing should start reading for grain production.
In inlet 3: Defines the sample increment used while reading sound buffer~ contents. This changes the perceived pitch, with 1.0 resulting in normal playback. The absolute value of any negative numbers are used to prevent buffer overrun errors. If backward playback is desired, use the reverse 1 message.
In inlet 4: Defines the gain multiplier. All values within a grain will be scaled by this number, with 1.0 resulting in no change.

method.name: setSound
method.digest: Set the name of the sound buffer~ used for grain production.
method.description: The word setSound, followed by the name of a buffer~ object, uses that object's sample memory as source sound for grain production. Note that this buffer~ object can have up to 2 channels. In the case of 1 channel (mono), the sound produced by both the first and second outlets will be the same. In the case of 2 channels (stereo), the first outlet will playback sound from the first channel (left) and the second outlet will playback sound from the second channel (right). Changes sent by the setSound message are deferred to the start of the next grain.

method.name: setWin
method.digest: Set the name of the window buffer~ used for grain production.
method.description: The word setWin, followed by the name of a buffer~ object, uses that object's sample memory as a window function for grain production. Note that this buffer~ object can only have 1 channel (mono). Changes sent by the setWin message are deferred to the start of the next grain.

method.name: reverse
method.digest: Read the defined buffer~ segment backwards. Default is off.
method.description: A reverse 1 message will play the defined buffer~ segment backwards. A reverse 0 message will play the defined buffer~ segment forward. Changes sent by the reverse message are deferred to the start of the next segment.

method.name: sndInterp
method.digest: Use interpolation while reading samples from the sound buffer~. Default is on.
method.description: An sndInterp 1 message will use linear interpolation while reading from the sound buffer~. An sndInterp 0 message will use no interpolation while reading from the sound buffer~.

method.name: winInterp
method.digest: Use interpolation while reading samples from the window buffer~. Default is on.
method.description: An winInterp 1 message will use linear interpolation while reading from the window buffer~. An winInterp 0 message will use no interpolation while reading from the window buffer~.

method.name: getinfo
method.digest: Post information about object to Max window
method.description: Retrieves basic information about the object author and when the object was last updated. Date can be used to identify different versions of the objects in circulation.
